venue.name: Boston University Center for Digital Imaging Arts

item.description:
Rob Sylvan Monday September 10th, 2012, 7:30–9:30pm

Learning a new version of Lightroom may feel like swimming upstream, but fear not, help is at hand! Rob Sylvan has been answering questions from Lightroom users since the first version was first released in 2007 and has found that many people struggle with the same core issues. It has become his mission to help other people learn how to build a strong foundational understanding of how Lightroom works so that they can be more productive and efficient in their own workflow, while avoiding the pitfalls, frustration, and mistakes of those that have come before them. In this presentation Rob will cover:

  • The relationship between the Lightroom catalog and your photos.
  • How to keep Lightroom from taking over your computer.
  • How to configure Lightroom for optimal performance.
  • How to work with multiple catalogs.
  • How to use Lightroom to perform basic file management.
  • How to be your own Lightroom Help Desk.

Ample time will be left at the end of the presentation to get your own burning Lightroom questions answered, so come prepared to ask. No question is too small.

Rob Sylvan is a freelance photographer, teacher, and author, who is also the Lightroom HelpDesk Specialist for the National Association of Photoshop Professionals and Kelby Training, as well as an instructor for the Perfect Picture School of Photography and thedigitalphotoworkshops.com. Rob writes the “Under the Loupe” column for Photoshop User Magazine and is the author of Lightroom 2 for Dummies, Lightroom 3 Video QuickStart Guide, and several other books on photography related topics. He blogs about Lightroom over at lightroomers.com.

LOCATION
Center for Digital Imaging Arts
274 Moody Street
Waltham, MA 02453

Registration: 6:30–7:30pm
Program: 7:30–9:30pm

Cost: CIPNE Members, Free; Guests, $35; Full-time Students*, $5.

*Full-time students will be required to present their photo-IDs at registration.

Pre-registration is required for this program.

Cost: CIPNE Members, Free; Non-members, $35, Student, $5.

Click here to register (Non-members may pay by PayPal)
Please note: on-line registration closes September 9th.

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Lightroom 4: Workflow, new features, and all your questions answered!
